gurmukhi: maU mdn rwj rwjw niRpiq niRp Aibbyk mMqRI kIXo ]ijh dyv deIq gMDRb mun jIq AfMf fMfih lIXo 166 ]
translation: O beautiful king like the god of love ! you have made that Avivek you minister, who after conquering the gods, demons, Gandharvas and sages had received tributes from them.166.

transliteration: Javan Kruddh Kai Juddh Karan Kairav Ran Ghaae|| Jaas Kop Ke Keen Sees Das Sees Gadaae||

gurmukhi: jvn kRu`D kY ju`D krx kYrv rx Gwey ]jws kRoD ky kIn KSt kul jwdv ju`Jy ]
transliteration: Jaoun Kruddh Ke Keee Dev Daanav Ran Lujjhe|| Jaas Krodh Ke Keen Khasht Kul Jaadav Jujjhe||
translation: Because of the anger of this Avivek, Karan and Kaurvas were destroyed in the battlefield; because of its anger, Ravana had to lose all his ten heads;

gurmukhi: soaU qws mwn sYnwiDpq jidn ros vhu Awie hY ]ibn iek ibbyk sunho niRpq Avr smuih ko jwie hY ]167]
transliteration: Sooo Taas Maan Sainaadhipat Jading Ros Vahu Aae Hai|| Bin Ik Bibek Sounho Nripat Avar Samuh(i) Ko Jaae Hai||167||
translation: Therefore, O the master of he armies ! O king ! the day when getting enraged, your Avivek will become out of control, on that day, it will overshadow all without influencing the one Vivek (discriminating intellect).167.
Speech of Parasnath addressed to Matsyendra :

gurmukhi: sunhu miCMdR bYn kho quih bwq ibc`Cn ]iek ibbyk Aibbyk jgq d√çY niRpq su l`Cn ]
transliteration: Sounoh Machhindra Bain Kaho Tuh(i) Baat Bichachchhan|| Ik Bibek Abibek Jagad Dvai Nripat Su Lachchhan||
translation: O Matsyendra ! listen, I tell you a distincitive thing; Vivek and Avivek both are the kings of distinct characteristics (of the world);

gurmukhi: bf joDw duhUM sMg bfy doaU Awp DnurDr ]eyk jwq iek pwq eyk hI mwq joDwbr ]
transliteration: Bad Jodhaa Duhoon San Bade Dooo Aap Dhanurdhar|| Ek Jaat Ik Paat Ek Himaat Jodhaabar||
translation: Both are great fighters and archers; both have the same caste and the same mother;

gurmukhi: iek qwq eyk hI bMs pun bYr Bwv duh ikm gho ]iqh nwm Twm AwBrx rQ SsqR AsqR sB muin kho ]168]
transliteration: Ik Taat Ik Hibans Poun Bait Bhaav Duh Kim Gado|| Tih Naam Thaam Aabharan Rath Shastra Astra Sabh Mounndi) Kaho||168||
translation: Both have the same father and the same dynasty, then how can there be enmity between them? O sage ! now you tell me about their place, name ornaments, chariots, arms, weapons etc.168.
Speech of Matsyendra addressed to Parasnath :

gurmukhi: Aisq brx Aibbyk Aisq bwjI rQ soBq ]Aisq bsqR iqh AMg inrK nwrI nr loBq ]
transliteration: Asit Baran Abibek Asit Baajirath Sobhat|| Asit Bastra Tih An Niakh Naarinar Lobhat||
translation: Avivek has black colour, black chariot and black horses; his garments are black also; seeing him, all the men and women around;

gurmukhi: Aisq swrQI AgR Aisq AwBrx rQo qm ]Aisq DnK kr Aisq Dujw jwnk purKoqm ]
transliteration: Asit Saarthi Agra Sot Aabharan Ratho Tam|| Asit Dhanakh Kar Asit Dhujaa Jaanak Purkhotam||
translation: His charioteer is also black, whose garments are also black; his chariot is also darkness; his bow and banner are all black and he considers himself a superb and superior peroson;

gurmukhi: ieh Cb nryS Aibbyk niRp jgq jXM kr mwnIXY ]An ij`q jws kh nw qjo ikSn rUp iqh jwnIXY ]169]
transliteration: Eh Chhab Daresh Abibek Nrip Jagad Jayan Kar Maaneeyai|| An Jitt Jaas Kah Naa Tajo Kishan Roop Tih Jaaneeyai||169||
translation: O king ! this is the pretty appearance of Avivek with which he has conquered the world; he is unconquerable and consider him as the likeness of Krishna.169.
